intro: Amaranthus hendersonii, commonly known as the Henderson amaranth, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and vibrant, showy bracts that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in the axils of the leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species. The Henderson amaranth is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its striking appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
